lead_paragraph: Though Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake said the city was clearing its 5,000 miles of road lanes as fast as possible, she and other officials could not say when most streets would be plowed.
snippet: Though Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake said the city was clearing its 5,000 miles of road lanes as fast as possible, she and other officials could not say when most streets would be plowed.

headline.main: Still Buried in Baltimore, Some Dig Their Own Path
headline.print_headline: Still Buried in Baltimore, Some Dig Their Own Path

abstract: Residents of Baltimore's Hampden neighborhood, tired of being stranded by snow-clogged streets in absence of city plows, dig their way out with shovels.
